intro: Endlicheria guadalupensis, commonly known as the Guadalupensis Endlicheria, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Endlicheria guadalupensis is often found in rocky or limestone habitats, showcasing its adaptability to specific ecological conditions.
